name: Ex Machina: Fact vs. Fiction Trivia Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What does Hundred want to crack down on in the first issue?
questions.explanation:
Fortune telling.

	Mayor Hundred wants to crack down on fortune telling, which is technically illegal. Despite the advice of his staff, Hundred demands that the law be enforced.

questions.text: What did Zehala want to be when she grew up?
options: The mayor of New York City
questions.explanation:
A marine biologist.

	Zehala, a fortune teller, reveals to Hundred that she foresaw the events of 9/11, but Hundred isn't sure if he should believe her or not. She takes offense at the term "gypsy", preferring to instead be called "Roma".

questions.text: There is a new costumed hero in New York City! What is the name of the hero?
questions.explanation:
Automaton.

	According to the Automoton himself, he was made by the Great Machine, Hundred's alter ego during his largely unsuccessful crime-fighting days. The new hero's method of speech makes people think he is a robot, but underneath the armor he is simply a man.

questions.text: Kremlin and Bradbury discover that the new robotic superhero is actually Jared Leto.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Jared Leto, like his father before him, ran a comic book store that Hundred used to frequent before becoming the mayor of New York City. Leto reasoned that now that Hundred had hung up his mantle as the Great Machine, someone had to step in.

questions.text: What does Hundred take time from his job out to do?
questions.explanation:
Serve jury duty.

	Hundred is unexpectedly called for jury duty and decides not to seek an exemption from it, convinced that his actions may show the public that he is willing to play by the rules. He is convinced that the whole trial will take less than a weekend and that he'll be back on the job by the following Monday.

questions.text: Who does Kremlin call in to help him investigate the new hero?
questions.explanation:
Bradbury.

	Kremlin, former confidante of Hundred during his Great Machine days, decides to investigate Automaton after Commissioner Angotti interrogates him about the "robot".  Kremlin tells Bradbury "It is time for knights to defend their king."

questions.text: Easy Benson, another juror serving with Hundred, pulls a gun on an old woman who is also serving on the jury.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Easy Benson claimed to be a Gulf War veteran who suffered from symptoms he believed only Hundred could cure. Supposedly a former member of the Marines, Benson threatened the old woman with a pair of scissors. After the conflict is brought to an end, a background check shows that Benson never served with the Marines.

questions.text: On July 25, 2000, Hundred works to save a Staten Island ferry. Before he gets there, what happens?
options: He is hit by a huge wave
He responds to a more serious distress call
questions.explanation:
He is struck by lightning.

	Hundred, as the Great Machine, races to save a ferry full of people that is in danger of capsizing due to a storm.  He is hit by a bolt of lightning and survives thanks to carbon mesh armor, but he is cut off from communicating with Bradbury.

questions.text: When Hundred pays a visit to his estranged mother, she tells him that she murdered his father.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Martha Hundred had always told her son Mitchell that his father died in a cave-in while he was working underground. She later recanted, saying that she beat his head in with a poker in self-defense when he came home drunk.

questions.text: Hundred's mother is being menaced by a loan shark called Timberwolf. How much money does Timberwolf demand?
questions.explanation:
Seven hundred dollars.

	Timberwolf and his gang have been extorting money from Martha Hundred for three months. Hundred persuades them not to bother Martha anymore, thinking that the rifles carried by the gang were unloaded. Only after the gang had dispersed did Hundred accidentally fire one round into the ground.
